alert.note: Alert for Cocke; Greene (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 3:27PM CDT until August 12 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Cocke County in east Tennessee... Greene County in east Tennessee... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 427 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from White Pine to near Newport to 10 miles northwest of Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, moving east northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Greeneville, Newport, Tusculum, Parrottsville, Mosheim, Caney Branch, Del Rio, Bybee, Chucky, and Cedar Creek. This includes Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 435 and 438. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
